intro: Eriogonum revolutum, commonly known as the rolledleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often rolled leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Eriogonum revolutum is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to arid environments.
